row.entry: This panel allows to manipulate history stack (development) of images. For each image, development is written in a sidecar file (.xmp) and is fully non-destructive.

sect4.title: copy
sect4.para: Copy the history stack of the first selected image. You will be prompted for the items to include.

sect4.title: copy all
sect4.para: Copy the complete history stack of the first selected image; all items will be included.

sect4.title: discard
sect4.para: Physically delete the history stack of the selected images. Beware, this action can not be undone!

sect4.title: overwrite/append
sect4.para: Describes how a new history stack must behave if pasted on an image having already an history stack. Overwrite will delete previous history stack whereas append will add the two history stacks.

sect4.title: paste
sect4.para: Paste a previously copied history stack on all selected images. You will be prompted for the items to include. This button is greyed out until a history stack is copied from another image.

sect4.title: paste all
sect4.para: Paste all previously copied items of a history history stack on all selected images. This button is greyed out until a history stack is copied from another image.

sect4.title: load sidecar file
sect4.para: Prompt a dialog box to allow you to select a .xmp file, thus loading an history stack that you can paste on images.

sect4.title: write sidecar files
sect4.para: Write .xmp sidecar files for all selected images. By default darktable will do this automatically for you whenever you work on an image and change history stack. You can deactivate automatic sidecar file generation in the preferences dialog, which is not recommended.
